column3: Introduce noise into your statistics to protect privacy
column4: Introduce noise into your statistics to protect privacy

column3: DP Creator allows researchers to easily introduce noise into variables masking specific details to keep private data private.
column4: DP Creator allows researchers to easily introduce noise into variables masking specific details to keep private data private.

column3: Review requirements
column4: Sign Up

column3: Make sure your data is ready and appropriate to be processed with DP Creator by checking the Tips for Use, then create your account to get started.
column4: Before starting, you have to make sure your data is appropriate to be processed with this tool by checking the following tips and terms of use.

column3: Connect a dataset
column4: Start the process

column3: DP Creator works with a temporary copy of the first 20 variables of a file you send from a registered Dataverse data repository to create differentially private summary statistics from the variables you choose.
column4: When you log in you can start working with your Dataverse file. We’ll use the first 20 variables of your dataset.

column3: Work on a release
column4: Work on release

column3: DP Creator guides you through 4 steps: Confirm variables, Set epsilon value, Create statistics, Generate DP Release. You can save along the way, and have 72 hours to complete the release.
column4: You can work with your data in 4 steps: Confirm variables, Set epsilon value, Create statistics, Generate DP Release. You'll see more information about the steps during the process. You have 72 hours to finish your release or the data will be deleted from the tool.

column3: Review and submit
column4: Check the release

column3: After processing, review the release in DP Creator. When you're ready, submit the release to the referring Dataverse repository dataset for sharing and publication.
column4: Once you finish the steps, the file has to be processed and it can take minutes or hours. You’ll receive an email when it's done.

column3: Tips for Use
column4: Terms of Service

column3: Who should use this tool and why?
column4: Who should use this tool and why?

column3: DP Creator supports depositing restricted files to a registered Dataverse repository with differentially private statistics about those files that are open to anyone. You should not use DP Creator if sharing the data could cause severe harm (link to reference – FAQs?).

column3: A DP release includes 3 files; a .pdf and machine readable JSON and XML formats. These files are deposited back to the Dataverse repository installation and are published as part of the original dataset. They provide a sense of what's in the data. (Add: can it be cited? etc)

column3: I have read the tips for use
This is a sentence about Open DP
column4:
This is a sentence
about Open DP

column3: OpenDP is a community effort to build trustworthy, open-source software tools for statistical analysis of sensitive private data. These tools offer the rigorous protections of differential privacy for the individuals who may be represented in confidential data and statistically valid methods of analysis for researchers who study the data.
column4: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Animi iusto in, voluptas quia fugiat soluta labore consectetur harum repellendus accusamus quisquam quasi velit vero totam, optio assumenda atque obcaecati eum!

column3: First, review, adjust and confirm the variables. These will be considered in the generation of the differential privacy release. Consider adjusting if... To adjust, set a reasonable, approximate range depending on the variable's type in the table below.
column4:
First, you have to review, adjust and confirm the variables of your dataset. These will be considered in the generation of
the differential privacy release. To adjust the necessary parameters to complete the process, you will need to set a valid
range depending on the variable's type in the table below.

column3: E.g. Numerical: minX - max: Y; Categorical: cat1,cat2,cat3
column4: E.g. Numerical: minX - max: Y; Categorical: cat1,cat2,cat3

column3: Type is inferred when data is imported. If it is not inferred correctly, cancel the release, and edit the original file.
column4: Type is inferred. Edit it in the original file

column3: Epsilon is a metric of privacy loss. The smaller the value is, the better the privacy protection. To determine the epsilon value, we need to confirm your dataset's characteristics with some questions about the sample.
column4: To determine the epsilon value, we need to confirm your dataset's characteristics with some questions about the sample.

column3: Epsilon is a metric of privacy loss at a differentially change in data (adding, removing 1 entry). The smaller the value is, the better privacy protection.
column4: Epsilon is a metric of privacy loss at a differentially change in data (adding, removing 1 entry). The smaller the value is, the better privacy protection.

column3: For example, information about persons, their behavior, beliefs and attributes is generally private information that individuals in the dataset would not want publicly shared in their name and should be marked 'yes'. Information that is solely about instituons,corporations, natural phenomena, etc., that are public record and can be publicly distributed, does not depend on private information.
column4: For example, information about persons, their behavior, beliefs and attributes is generally private information that individuals in the dataset would not want publicly shared in their name and should be marked 'yes'. Information that is solely about instituons, corporations, natural phenomena, etc., that are public record and can be publicly distributed, does not depend on private information.

column3: For example, the number of observations in a dataset containing a 5% sample of California voters is public, but the number of observations in a dataset containing all cancer patients in a particular hospital may not be public, as it could be combined with auxiliary information to reveal whether or not a patient has cancer.
column4: For example, the number of observations in a dataset containing a 5% sample of California voters is public, but the number of observations in a dataset containing all cancer patients in a particular hospital may not be public, as it could be combined with auxiliary information to reveal whether or not a patient has cancer.

column3: Create the statistics you would like to release. Confirm the default levels or edit them to change the degree of noise or interference you'd like to add. The default values distribute epsilon evenly across variables.
column4: Create the statistics you would like to release. Please edit and confirm the degree of noise or interference you'd like to add to the statistics.

column3: Where should these links go? (or one link in the epsilon warning, below?)
column4: Where should these links go?

column3: Changing the epsilon, delta, or confidence level will directly impact the privacy settings. Every DP statistic has a different tradeoff between epsilon value and accuracy. Splitting the budget evenly can diminish the usefulness of statistics. More complex statistics will generally require more budget. Link to more info
column4:
Changing the epsilon, delta, or confidence level will directly impact the privacy settings. We recommend
using the default values provided by the system

column3: You can apply different statistics to single or multiples variables. Then, you can edit these statistics, lock them or delete them so that changes...
column4:
You can apply different statistics to single or multiples variables. Then, you can edit these statistics, lock them or delete
them.

column3: The recommended values below are based upon your dataset type selection

column3:
Note: Larger X corresponds to larger privacy loss budget, and hence, less privacy.
We do not recommend X exceding 1.
column4:
Note: Larger X corresponds to larger privacy loss budget, and hence, less privacy.
We do not recommend X exceding 1.

column3: Note: X is the probability of a blatant privacy violation. X values larger than the reciprocal of the dataset size are not allowed.
column4: Note: X is the probability of a blatant privacy violation. X values larger than the reciprocal of the dataset size are not allowed.

column3: The level of privacy protection for individuals in the dataset is governed by two privacy-loss parameters - x & x.
column4: The level of privacy protection for individuals in the dataset is governed by two privacy-loss parameters - x & x. Watch video to learn more.

column3:
The final step is to submit the statistics and generate the differential privacy release. This will finalize the current
selections and spend your allocated privacy budget on them.
column4:
The final step is to submit the statistics and generate the differential privacy release. This will finalize the current
selections and spend your allocated privacy budget on them.
